item.title: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it
item.description:
An attempt of a properly styled animated badge prompted by @jsiepkes’s comment on HN:

base64-encoded image <img src="data:image/gif;base64,">

Full quote by George Santayana:

Progress, far from consisting in change, depends on retentiveness. When change is absolute there remains no being to improve and no direction is set for possible improvement: and when experience is not retained, as among savages, infancy is perpetual. Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.

item.title: Catalay: automatic catalogue layouts for InDesign made declaratively, slightly smart
item.description: This is yet another release post, this time for Catalay â€” a free software suite designed to automate the layout of image catalogues made with Adobe InDesign, using simple, declarative, human readable and editable configuration files in TOML or YAML formats as input. The main feature is not just automatically laying out the images in a grid, but adapting the grid layout itself. Catalay preserves the size relationship between different groups of items on each page are, scaling them appropriately, while utilizing the page as efficiently as possible given the constraints.

item.title: Architect logo redesign
item.description: Architect Linux is an installer for the glorious Arch linux. It is distributed as a live-cd ISO, which boots into pseudo-graphical mode and allows installing Arch via comprehensible script which is updated prior to installation from Architect github-repo.
